bill_title: provide for the use of a DNA profile in certain warrants, indictments, and informations.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to provide for the use of a DNA profile in certain warrants, indictments, and informations. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 23A-2-4 be amended to read as follows: 23A-2-4. Each arrest warrant shall be dated and contain its place of issuance. It The warrant shall be signed by a committing magistrate. It The warrant shall contain the name of the defendant or, if his the defendant's name is unknown, any DNA profile, name or description by which he the defendant can be identified with reasonable certainty. It The warrant shall command that the defendant be brought before the nearest available committing magistrate. The committing magistrate who signs the warrant shall also endorse the amount of bail on it the warrant . Section 2. That § 23A-6-7 be amended to read as follows: 23A-6-7. An indictment or information is sufficient if it can be understood therefrom from the indictment or information : (1) That it the indictment or information is entitled in a court having authority to receive it the indictment or information , although the name of the court is not stated; (2) That the indictment was found by a grand jury of the county in which the public offense was committed; (3) That the defendant is named or, if his the defendant's name is unknown, that he the defendant is described by a DNA profile or a fictitious name with a statement that his the defendant's true name is unknown to the grand jury or prosecuting attorney; (4) That the offense charged was committed within the jurisdiction of the county; and (5) That the offense charged is designated in such a manner as to enable a person of common understanding to know what is intended.

action_log.status_text: First read in House and referred to
